That’s it!

Maybe the birds’

beaks changed depending

on the food available

on the island where

they lived.

The birds living on each island adapted to their respective environments, changing little by little into different forms.

Birds that flew over

to the Galapagos from the South American continent long ago adapted to the unique island ecosystems and remained here.

Then,

over the passage

of time, they evolved into slightly different species.

124
